oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Direct drilling and reduced tillage: - may increase T-2/HT-2 -producers, especially on oats - may decrease DON-producers, especially F. culmorum > is it long lasting effect? - an increase F. avenaceum infection in humid growing seasons - effect on F. culmorum - less f. poae -infection especially on oats -effect on F. graminearum: -not detected, the species is quite common but perithecia are not often detected -F. graminearumis most likely increasing-changes the situation.
Control of mycotoxin producers in reduced tillage: -fungicide treatments not effective to control Fusariumand mycotoxins -crop rotation important -resistant cultivars
